name: YouTube Longform Video
primary_goal_vibe: Evergreen discovery, education, authority building, and long-term audience growth through search and suggested videos.
tone_preference: Educational, confident, structured, and value-first. Human and clear, but not improvised or trend-driven.

copy_guidelines.copy_best_practices: The title carries the main CTR responsibility and must state the key outcome or benefit clearly. The first two lines of the description must summarize what the viewer will learn or gain. The rest of the description expands with context, resources, timestamps, and CTAs.
copy_guidelines.caption_structure_hint: Title: clear promise and topic. Description lines 1–2: value summary. Body: context, steps, resources, links, timestamps. Final lines: CTA and hashtags.
cta_examples: Watch the next video in this playlist
Download the resource in the description

on_screen_text_guidelines.primary_role: Support clarity, labeling, and retention without replacing spoken content.
best_practices: Use lower thirds for key concepts and names
Use chapter labels when shifting topics

hashtags_mentions.recommended_hashtags: 3–8 relevant hashtags placed at the end of the description.
hashtags_mentions.hashtag_strategy: Use topic, industry, and outcome-based hashtags rather than generic trending tags.
hashtags_mentions.mention_strategy: Mention collaborators, tools, or guests in the description when contextually relevant.

technical_constraints.recommended_duration: 6–20 minutes for most educational and business use cases.
technical_constraints.thumbnail_note: High-contrast thumbnail with 1 clear concept and minimal text is required for strong CTR.

required_elements: Value summary in the first two lines of the description
disallowed_practices: Vague or curiosity-only titles with no clear outcome
Clickbait thumbnails that do not match the content
Burying the main CTA at the very end only
